yoruba: Pẹ̀tẹ̀pẹ́tẹ̀ Ìjèṣà, ó ta sẹ́ni lára kò wọ́n.
gold: The mud of the Ìjèṣà: it splashes on one and will not be washed off.
gen:
The Yoruba proverb "Pẹ̀tẹ̀pẹ́tẹ̀ Ìjèṣà, ó ta sẹ́ni lára kò wọ́n" translates to English as:

"The Ijesha slap/pat, it strikes one's body but it's not painful."

This proverb refers to something that appears threatening but is actually harmless, or something that seems severe but has little impact.
